description: Letters explaining that British embassies and consulates do not issue certificates of civil or family status or residency. Sometimes called information notes.

attachments.title: Croatia: family certificate and civil status unavailable
Belarus: family certificate and civil status unavailable
Azerbaijan: family certificate and civil status unavailable
Greece: family certificate and civil status unavailable
North Macedonia: civil status certificate unavailable
Switzerland: family certificate and civil status unavailable
All countries and territories: family circumstance certificate unavailable

details.body:
British embassies and consulates cannot issue certificates to confirm civil status, residency or family circumstances. This is because the UK does not have central registers that hold this information.

If you’re asked by local authorities to provide proof of this, download the relevant letter for free. You can get a signed and stamped version of a letter but this service costs £50.

Albania: family circumstance certificate unavailable

PDF, 89.9 KB, 2 pages

This file may not be suitable for users of assistive technology.

Request an accessible format.
If you use assistive technology (such as a screen reader) and need a version of this document in a more accessible format, please email fcdo.correspondence@fcdo.gov.uk. Please tell us what format you need. It will help us if you say what assistive technology you use.
